summary: An internal FBI email from July 2, 2019, sent shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's indictment in the Southern District of New York. It outlines immediate operational plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and interviews with co-conspirators and individuals in Florida.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the primary recipient, being informed of Epstein's indictment and asked to provide availability for the operational response.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; indicted in SDNY with an arrest warrant sworn out. Believed to be in France at the time, with plans to arrest him upon return to the U.S.

connections.description: Sean, as an FBI recipient of this operational email, is part of the law enforcement team planning to arrest Epstein and execute related warrants.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and an arrest warrant was sworn out.

events.title: Recipient Out of Town
events.description: The email sender notes they will be out of town from July 6-10, 2019.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning
events.description: The FBI squad is placed on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals.

locations: NYC (New York City, specifically Epstein's residence)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, with an arrest warrant issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
Additional immediate actions involved deploying two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals there.
The email indicates the investigation and arrest operation required the coordination of the entire FBI squad, with assistance from other units.
